page.title: 03Farms in the valley
page.content: Most of the farms are fell farms between 600 and 900ft above sea level. They keep sheep and cows for suckling calves and are not able to plough the rough ground.One farm is in the bottom of the valley and has a herd of ayrshires. The farms are Hazel Head 600ft Lowery Baskill 650ft Folders Old Hall 650ft Hoggarths Brighouse 650ft Atkinson Pike Side 900ft Askew Crosbythwaite 690ft Harrisons Sella 300ft Kirbys Long Garth 650ft Blancs. The farms are not intensive.Most people do hay and silage and have free range eggs.Most of the farmers put fertilizers on the meadow land.All of the farms are old and have been here for 300 years.
